intro: Sakoanala villosa, commonly known as the hairy sakoanala, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, clustered white or pink flowers that bloom during the wet season. Its leaves are typically opposite and have a rough texture due to the presence of fine hairs. Sakoanala villosa is often found in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests.
